website_summaries.verdict: This durable rotary grater showcases a sleek design alongside durable construction.
pros: Stainless steel design lasts for years
Can zest and grate cheese and chocolate
cons: Bigger than many customers expected, making the product awkward to use

customer_reviews.title: Bad in every aspect
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't really grate as much as it shaves tiny pieces. That is until it stops working. You have to push the top down with your thumb and it's really awkward. Eventually it wasn't strong enough to push through the cheese and it broke in my hand. I wouldn't say the worst product I have ever purchased but it is in the top 10 for sure.
customer_reviews.author: max ballentine

customer_reviews.title: It did not grate.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, I did not believe my wife and ended up having to throw it away and buy a different model. Did not grate it just mushed it, a little at a time. I am 6’, 200 lbs and had to exert so much force my thumbs hurt and even then it did not work well. Perhaps it will work better on VERY dry cheese, that is drier than parmigiana cheese....oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great in theory but difficult to use. You have to press really hard for it to work. The result is nice but not worth the work at all. Will be buying a different one. Used it twice and hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Not a cheese grater
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for grating Parmesan cheese. Upon opening, I could see the product was solid and of good quality. But the result of the grating was not what I expected. The flakes were about 1/4" x 1/4", far too large for Parmesan to be sprinkled on Italian pasta. The description does not specifically state that it is for grating cheese, but one would think the overall design lends itself for that purpose. Almost all the other similarly designed products offer 2 different flake drums; one for large and one for small flakes, whereas this one only has one for large. Shame on me for making assumptions.
customer_reviews.author: Bartolomei

customer_reviews.title: Great for parmesan
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made grater for parmesan. It grates the cheese in little paper-thin slices rather than straws, which is pretty cool and allows the cheese to breath and get great flavor. I do wish they would include some trigger mechanism to hold it closed better. It comes apart for easy cleaning and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Radcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Safety cover for storage is a must
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived without the protective cover. I imagine that when it is stored in a drawer, any items near the grater will be subject to easily becoming damaged when they touch the grating surface. It is very sharp and the bi-directional blade design leaves many unavoidable sharp edges.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Accents

customer_reviews.title: cutting blade wrong deminsions
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have returned this item. Soft cheese like cheddar gets stuck in the hole. Hard chees like parmesan does not feed well and comes out in large, very thin flakes. I do not like the cutting blades. They are too shallow and too big. The result is a really thin piece about the size of frosted flake cereal. But super thin.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. It’s perfect. Please note that this makes small paper thin slices but doesn’t grate like the ones at the restaurants do.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Sellas

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Better than other products like this one Better outcome with the cheese
customer_reviews.author: lindalee500

customer_reviews.title: Not great if you have arthritis
customer_reviews.text: This does not seem like a very ergonomic design to me. Clumsy angle and difficult
customer_reviews.author: Camille L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdier than my previous grater.
customer_reviews.text: Big flakes that instantly melt when they land on hot pasta and sauce! Nice.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rousseau

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: JUNK. Made of weak plastic body. Only the grater drum is Stainless Steel. Delivered June 1, 2020. In Trash July 31, 2020. Want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas barrett

customer_reviews.title: Item broke after 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: We've had many cheese graters. This one looked solid but the turn mechanism broke after just minimal usage and after 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola Elardo

customer_reviews.title: The product broke after a couple uses. I was expecting something a little more durable
customer_reviews.text: The product broke after a couple uses. I was expecting something a little more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Prazer

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Breaks with hours bought 5 for a restaurant. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Strawn

customer_reviews.title: poor design
customer_reviews.text: hard to crank easier to get out the box grater
customer_reviews.author: Linda Colombo

customer_reviews.title: POS... Don’t waste your $$$
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! Gears stripped out in less than a year of maybe twice a month use. POS!
customer_reviews.author: RGN733

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Of the many I have had this is the best!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: victordg13

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted one of these, but always found them cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: Layton D Johnson Jr

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted about a week, after that it wouldn’t grate anything...
customer_reviews.author: Sir Eric

customer_reviews.title: Big and Small; Cheese comes out in flakes
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet...but two criticisms right off the bat. It is HUGE, hard to fit in a kitchen drawer and the chamber for the items to be grated is relatively small. Will re-post after it's been used. It replaces an OXO which we loved and had for years but finally broke. Our model OXO is no longer made and the replacement gets bad reviews so we tried this because of the good reviews. Update: As others have noted, the cheese comes out in flakes which causes it to clump and not mix into pasta evenly. My wife is very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. L

customer_reviews.title: BIG
customer_reviews.text: This is larger than the ones I have had over the years. So it requires more space in the kitchen cabinet than anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Lowenthal

customer_reviews.title: I love the non-slip grip!
customer_reviews.text: This Box Grater is so easy to use, and has 4 different grating features. I love how it stays in place, because of the rubber base. It doesn't slip when I am trying to grate harder cheese. It has a small flake grater, coarse grater, large flake grater and a large coarse grater. My favorite is the smaller grater options, because I usually just use this for cheese. You can, however, use it for veggies like carrots and cucumbers. It also suggests that you can use this for chocolate. Its a big grater, and the rubber grip handle makes it really easy to hold onto. So far, this is the best grater I have ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Summer Girl

customer_reviews.title: A flaker, not a grater
customer_reviews.text: This is a high-quality product that produces nice flakes from moderately hard, flat food--like cheese or a large potato. It's not so great at very hard things or softer things; nor things with small curves like a lemon. The flakes are nice for some purposes. They're more attractive than shreds or small balls in a salad or as a garnish, and they can be used to form thin layers. I find they mix better if, for example, you're grating cheese for pasta, or vegetables to toss in a chopped salad. The tool is solid, sharp and well-designed. It cleans easily, unlike most graters.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Performs flawlessly but limited with only one type of grating
customer_reviews.text: My unit was advertised when I ordered it as having two drums but after shipping I noticed that the wording had been changed as only having the "fine flake" drum. I will say that the fine flake drum does do paper thin flakes of parmesan which are uniform and very impressive, but actually too thin for my liking for cheese, almost too thin to taste when put on pasta. Probably better suited for hard chocolate. It prominently features "stainless steel" on the description but that's only the drum--- most of the unit is plastic. Would have been five stars if they would have included several drums to give more flexibility in its use.
customer_reviews.author: James John Hollandsworth, M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use and clean grater that works great when you want to great cheese (or chocolate) at the table as opposed to in the kitchen. I say this because once you load the cheese (and it will need to be in a small enough size to fit in the top of the grater), you won't have to put your hands all over it which might gross your dinner guests out (especially the germaphobes). This particular rotary grater is sharp and easy to use for either right-handers or left-handers and produces thin, but fairly large flakes (especially good for salads). It's also dishwasher safe and easy to clean. Overall, a good and useful grater.
customer_reviews.author: JD Cetola

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: After watching cooking shows, I wanted a nice hand grater. So nice to grate a lemon or an orange and not pull out my larger grater. This fits so nice in my hand. Wash up was easy. I can keep it right in my kitchen drawer where it's handy since I use graters all the time. Looks well made. I've hand washed this and have tossed in dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: D.Berdanis

customer_reviews.title: Rotary grater - works well on cheese and chocolate
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Sabatier rotary grater. It is well made and the mechanism works smoothly. I own a box grater but always seem to cut myself in some way when trying to grate cheese or chocolate. This type of grater, along with the quality, has made a huge difference. I am able to grate more quickly without worrying about nicking myself. I grate mostly cheese and some chocolate and this works well on both. It also cleans up easily. For me this is a nice improvement over a box grater.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Quality grater great for grating large quantities (a.k.a. how many times can I say grate/great in one review title)
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this grater. I will admit that it's not the most COMFORTABLE grater to use, mostly because it's so big and therefore SHOULD have a better shaped/molded handle...but it's SO sturdy! And I love the size. I'm often grating larger quantities of stuff and because this is bigger than any other grater I've used, it allows for more buildup inside before I need to empty it out. It's a bit pricey but with as sturdy as it is, I see it lasting for a while, so unless something happens in that respect I will stick by this 5-star review :)
customer_reviews.author: T.L. Walker

customer_reviews.title: User friendly and the grates are more of a flake or shave style.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This grater is great! The Sabatier is not your basic grater. The structure of it is way different from other graters and so is the grating pattern. You will not get a basic grate but more of a flake or shave style which is what I prefer. You can always tell an exceptional grater by the way it grates and the Sabatier is one awesome grater. It is easy to use but as in all graters, you have to watch out for your fingers. Not much pressure is need to start the grate as he blades are sharp. Fits great in my hand and does not slip on the surface while grating which is a big plus! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Stroh

customer_reviews.title: Fancy Grater
customer_reviews.text: This is a fancy box grater, it uses the cutting teeth you'd normally find on the newer places/microplanes, but adds a cross action to it so you can go a bit faster/easier. The only major complaint is the handle works for holding it, but it isn't perfect -- hands still get sore, and that the box grater itself is fairly small, so you'll have to empty it a lot, or put it on top of something larger, but hard to find something that makes it comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MrE

customer_reviews.title: A grate grater! ;)  This is a nice piece of kitchen gear!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little grater, and it works well with chocolate, cheese, and veggies. It fits well into most drawers and is relatively easy to clean. Of course, it's sharp so be careful and keep out of reach of small fingers. Recommended as a nice-to-have, and maybe a nice low-cost gift for your culinary friends.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Big, but gets the job done fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a good grater. It grates in both directions, so it makes the job go faster. It has the sharp parts on the rounded corners, rather than the flat edges. At first, I thought this was going to be a problem, but it seems to make it easier to grate without getting my hand cut up. The best part is that it doesn't slip around in use, which is another safety feature. It is fairly large, so keep that in mind for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Logue

customer_reviews.title: Medium bi-directional grater
customer_reviews.text: The handle on this grater did make it easier to hold than my old metal handled one. It also does grate in both directions, so it seems to work more quickly, though the food being grated is just a tad more difficult to clean from the grater. (You can't just sweep away the residue off in one direction.) I love the safety cover as the grating edges are very sharp. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Blue

customer_reviews.title: Good zester
customer_reviews.text: Sabatier is known for its excellent products. I have the citrus zester. It is a very good quality, and it’s easy to handle. The blades are stainless steel, and they are sharp. The zester works like a charm to easily grate citrus and even hard cheeses. Plus I did’t knick my fingers when using it—a huge plus for me. Cleanup is very easy. The zester is dishwasher safe, and doesn’t tarnish or rust. Overall, a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Maines, best-selling, award-winning author, actor, and editor

customer_reviews.title: Works great for most citrus and even chocolate
customer_reviews.text: This is an very good zester. It fits my hand well and works great. I would have given it 5 stars if the grates were just a bit smaller. It works well for most things but I think smaller grater holes would be just a bit better for grating things like orange peel for decorations. I would recommend it for everyone who needs a good grater. It did a great job on chocolate too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap -- Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made and barely works. It feels like it's going to break every time we try to use it. It doesn't grate very well and is difficult to clean. Not worth it. Skip this. Pay the extra for a better made product.
customer_reviews.author: akb-bookwrom

customer_reviews.title: Sabatier 5213178 West Blade Bi-Directional Handheld Manual Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and compact shape. I like the handheld aspect of the grater, feels comfortable. And the grater produces flakes of cheese rather than strings. Works for me. Easy to clean and does not take up much space in drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Bigstory

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely for line and lemon zesting
customer_reviews.text: I rarely grate cheese or harder vegetables like carrots, but we do use like and lemon peel zests when cooking. This is a decent tool for that purpose. It's reasonably easy to hold steady and the edges are sharp enough to get the job done without serious effort. For my light duty needs, this is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs & Horses

customer_reviews.title: Light flakes
customer_reviews.text: I have used this with cheese and chocolate, I think it works better on the hard cheese. It made nice little flakes, with the handle it is easier to hold and maneuver but not as easy as other graters. I think this works better when you only have small amounts to grate.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. ChaCha

customer_reviews.title: super high quality Zester!
customer_reviews.text: rock solid zester... did some potatoes, and blades were utlra sharp, ergonomics were superb... I like the cover as well, stops accidental injury this company makes first class products will buy their new rotatry shredder !
customer_reviews.author: funbear

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grating small pieces
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! I only have a 4 sided grater which is kind of a pain to grate small. This was perfect to grate ginger into my stir fry. Not big slices but it's better than using a knife to cut up the pieces. It also fits perfectly over a bowl and is very sturdy. I really love this!
customer_reviews.author: M. Cargill

customer_reviews.title: Great shreds of zest, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use to zest larger fruit such as oranges. Round razor holes work at better angles. Easy to hold handle. If you do a lot of baking with citrus, good to have. Definitely leaves white with on the fruit and makes good sized shreds of zest. Two ( unscathed) thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna D.

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Got this yesterday and have used it in dinner prep both nights. I love it. It is easy to use, leaves great shredsor cheese. Really great grip and I love the cover. I have no complaints, it is great..or grate..see what I did there! 😀😀
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Zolar

customer_reviews.title: A great grater
customer_reviews.text: I'm no whiz in the kitchen and can truly appreciate aids such as this grater. It's easy to hold, easy to use, and easy to clean. It'a a great grater in all ways.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Strong!
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality (doesn't bend under pressure like another one I own) and very sharp multi-grater! I use it for slicing and grating vegetables and cheese! And then I toss it in the dishwasher without any rinsing needed!
customer_reviews.author: B. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to Pampered Chef in quality
customer_reviews.text: Comparable in quality to my beloved Pampered Chef grater. This took down a block of cheddar like magic. A hard block of parmesan, no problem. I love this shredder and will reach for it often.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for zesting
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. I bought it for zesting lemons and oranges, but it’s not suitable for that and is very slow. I’m back to using my old microplane.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This grater is made very well and seems to be very durable. It is great at grating vegetables or cheese. Cleanup is not too bad. Good grater.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Works great & fast
customer_reviews.text: This seriously speeds up zesting citrus peel time! My Microplane is so slow - tiny pieces in only one direction. THis zests larger pieces, super quickly in both directions, without picking up the pith. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Smartly Created

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to use, and to store.
customer_reviews.text: This is awkward to use, and to store. If it had a hole in the handle, one could hang it from a hook. But it doesn’t, so it must go in a drawer.....where it takes up a LOT of room. The good news, I guess, is that it isn’t especially sturdy, and so will have a fairly short life, I think. I also think: don’t give up your unglamorous, standard, four-sided grater for this.
customer_reviews.author: Worddancer Redux

customer_reviews.title: Easily the worst kitchen gadget I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I own a Sabatier knife, and I know it's high-quality. So a Sabatier cheese grater? This purchase was a no-brainer. It was also a mistake. Apart from the grater cylinder, most of the tool is made of plastic. The first thing to go was a "chrome" insert that covered a screw. That popped off on the first day. When I squeeze the grater tightly, it pops open and the grater cylinder falls out. I threw away a perfectly good, but antique, Mouli grater so I could buy this piece of garbage. If I could turn back time, I'd tell my husband that no, we are NOT getting rid of that old Mouli grater.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Foley

customer_reviews.title: Performs well but I don't like the curve in the blade and I am unsure about safety
customer_reviews.text: [There are eight items under the same listing. My review is for the "Coarse Grater" in case you are not filtering by Style] This Sabatier Coarse Grater is well built and sharp and works quite well. The bidirectional feature eliminates the need to reposition whatever you're grating so you can grate on both up and down strokes. Unfortunately, t's uncomfortable to hold and it feels like you're going to catch a finger or knuckle on the blades. I also don't like the curve in the blade section because it ends up carving out a section if you're grating a big chunk of cheese and makes it hard to grate smaller items that have a natural curvature (lemons, limes, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Action Shredding
customer_reviews.text: I have used my rotary grater for parmesiano reggiano cheese, and it rapidly prepares thin, flavorful flakes in a jiffy. I love how easy it is to simply drop in a cut of cheese, lower the grip, and get straight down to business. My pasta didn’t even have time to cool down. My grater cleans with ease, and simplicity. I have no trouble opening the reliably clipped cover, by means of a full-sized finger slot, providing convenient access to shredder barrel for washing. The only metal is the shredder. The body is plastic. It’s not much to matter, considering its exceptional performance. I love using my Sabatier Rotary Shredder.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Imperfect, Awkward Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: Like cheese planes, I've had a difficult time finding the perfect grater. This one, too, disappoints. I found it awkward to use...and dangerous. It is really, really quite sharp. I didn't cut myself, but I did make myself nervous. Cheese worked...okay. But a lot of the cheese ended up stuck on the blades, and, yes, it's dangerous to get the cheese out. Although the writeup said it would work with onions, I mainly ended up with onion juice. Sweet potatoes worked a little better, but, again, so much of it ended up stuck in the blades. I'm about to the point where I'll give up on manual graters and just use a good food processor.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy and very good at grating cheese.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding small grater. Easy to use, easy to clean and small enough to store pretty much anywhere. The grater comes with a clip on cover to protect both the cutting face and any fingers that may come close when they aren't supposed to. I have used this grater multiple times on multiple cheeses, and also small potatoes but I wouldn't go any denser than that as the cutting edge may have troubles. Also hard cheese will be your friend here as softer cheeses may gum up the holes. Block Parmesan is choice, however you can do soft cheeses if you take your time. Cleaning is super easy, I hand wash carefully and then dry and store.
customer_reviews.author: CoreyZ

customer_reviews.title: Use for finely grating food
customer_reviews.text: This tool grates vegetables and cheese very fine. Some individuals may find the results too fine. The curved handle makes it easy to set the grater on a cutting board while grating. The blades allow for bi-directional grating. Grating with this tool does not go quickly. It takes many passes over the grater to produce even a small amount of grated cheese or vegetable. This grater would be appropriate if a small amount of finely grated food is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell R. Alegre

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I don't use grated cheese all that much, though I do have a traditional grater. This is better for light grating as it's easier to clean since it's almost flat instead of that triangular shape. I bought a block of mild cheddar that grated pretty well. It worked better when I held it in my left hand while raking the cheese across it with my right hand, my dominant hand. And you want to use the side that curves out to get the best contact. For the heck of it I took a piece of sugar free chocolate and ran it against the grater; it made kind of thin, small bits like sugar free chocolate snow.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: While fairly large, this grater is far easier to store than my old 4-sided grater that took up an entire drawer. The handle is comfortable to hold and it's well balanced. This works well with harder blocks of cheese and chocolate. I do not recommend for softer cheeses. The blade itself is thin. This keeps the cutting surfaces razor sharp. It comes with a protective cover to keep it from getting damaged in the drawer full of other utensils. Also keeps you from shaving a bit of skin off while reaching in the drawer for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Darcia Helle

customer_reviews.title: Not for long use on hard cheeses
customer_reviews.text: I had expected more from Sabatier, which has been a high-quality knife manufacturer. But the ergonomics on this coarse flake hand grater are not great if you process much cheese or other hard items. The blade looks decent but the handle grip and the curvature are the main problems if you use it for prolonged periods of time. If you plan to grate a few decorative shavings of chocolate, it is probably just fine. I'm sticking with my block grater.
customer_reviews.author: Herblady22

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy item in the kitchen! It has a nice handle that fits in my palm and I'm sure would be comfortable in a man's palm as well. It has very sharp blades for ease in creating the grated slices and a handy cover that snaps on/off for storage and use. I don't put a lot of pressure on the item, just slide the cheeses with just the slightest push- seems to be working for me.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous product
customer_reviews.text: This grater is sturdy and sharp. It does grate. The problem is the curved design causes whatever you are trying to grate (especially hard cheeses like Parmesan etc.) to slide off the edge and it grates your knuckles instead. Everyone in our family has suffered injuries from this thing since I bought it a few months ago. It’s in the trash after using it last night and cutting out yet another chunk of my knuckle. Don’t buy it. Buy a square flat-sided grater and save yourself the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Medley

customer_reviews.title: No blood involved! Citrus Zester
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tool for grating or zesting foods, and the best part is, you won’t end up with bloody fingers or knuckles! The holes somehow are able to grate and zest without being sharp on the surface - seems like magic to me! It does an excellent job in no time at all. It has a good sized surface to make quick work of any job. One of my new favorite kitchen tools!
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Fegler

customer_reviews.title: Great Grater!
customer_reviews.text: There's a special Italian soup that I like to make. It calls for a heel of Romano along with coarse flakes. This hand grater is easy to use and the flakes come out the perfect size. It feels ergonomically comfortable and my hands don't get tired. The blades are very sharp, making the grating an ease.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Brody

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it's for - so that's good!
customer_reviews.text: This does a fine job of making flakes of hard cheeses and the like. It feels a little awkward till you get used to it. It's rather large. I've flaked parmesan with it and it does a fine job. I hold it down against the counter on a paper plate or sheet of paper towel to do the grating.
customer_reviews.author: CheeryToes

customer_reviews.title: Easy, safe, fun
customer_reviews.text: If you want to avoid getting the bitter pith of limes, lemons, oranges, etc., you’ll want this tool – it slices off just the outer part, the rind, for that zesty flavor you want, without that little sting of bitterness. The design makes it safe on your fingers, plus it comes with a cover. Easy to hold and use, and makes the task faster and sort of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Grimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great for adding attractive finishing touches to a wide variety of dishes
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for flaking large items such as bars of chocolate, jerky (it's great sprinkled on scrambled eggs), hard cheeses such as cheddar, hard salami and some vegetables. I look at this as being useful for finishing touches rather than for preparing large batches of ingredients. this won't replace your microplane. Rather it will allow you to add great aesthetic touches to a wide variety of dishes.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Zest grate!
customer_reviews.text: This is a zester (ie for grating the peel off citruses), so people complaining that it doesn't do cheese or chocolate, well duh! I guess these folks also cut the Thanksgiving turkey with a butter knife?! It has a good sized handle so you can stabilize the mesh against the rind of the fruit and it does a grate job.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Zester
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It has a nice handle and I really like the cover for it. It feels like it's mad well. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the zest still sits on the back of this and I have to scrape it off. I have a small zester that doesn't do that but the zest pieces are a lot bigger. I like this size better.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This works great to get the thinnest slice of cheese. Regular grated cheese can be a bit too thick especially if you want to melt it in a short time. The slices are also good for the presentation if you desire to step it up a notch. Easy to use. I'm right handed so I hold this in my left hand and simply slide the cheese across. Doesn't take much pressure or effort.
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Amy

customer_reviews.title: This grater is grate!
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy little grater and Simple to use. The handle is comfortable to use and has a textured grip for your thumb to rest. Potatoes are easily sliced up into smaller flakes. Works both directions so it cuts prep time in half. It also comes with a plastic cover that easily snaps off and on when not in use
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Mc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and SHARP
customer_reviews.text: Love the variety of grating holes, from fine to slicing. The handle is sturdy and comfortable to hold, and the blades are razor sharp, and grate in both directions, up and down. It's quite large and since it's so sharp, I store it on an upper shelf. Wouldn't want to reach into a drawer and grab the sharp blades.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi D

customer_reviews.title: Had To Get The Hang Of It!....
customer_reviews.text: It took some trying to use to finally get it😂 I had to learn to hold the grater straight up for me. Not a tool I'll use everyday but it will be handy to have. My daughter is eager to make a cake so we can curl choclate. I like that it has a cover so I can store in the utensil drawer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Look forward to using for years and years
customer_reviews.text: Very cool kitchen gadget that makes shredding things like potatoes and carrots a breeze. I used it first to make hash browns one morning. It was almost effortless--and the potatoes were perfect and uniform. Carrot salad? Quick and easy! The tool cleans up easily in the dishwasher too.
customer_reviews.author: Rick R. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Recommended overall but most of all for the nice long handle....keeps your fingers away from the blades
customer_reviews.text: Very nice grater but I'm sorry this one is not for me. I have severe arthritis in my hands and I have to work my hands too hard for this to be a nice device for me. However my hubby does like it. That's why it got a "4". I like the long handle and it is very easy to clean. That makes it a hit for me.
customer_reviews.author: FiFi's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Creates beautiful flakes
customer_reviews.text: This hand grater is easy to use, almost effortless—you do have to turn the handle—and it produces beautiful flakes of cheese. I shredded a hard cheddar to mix with pasta and pesto, and it came out so lovely I grated more to put on top. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Myra

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality hand grater when you need coarse flakes, such as hard cheese to add to freshly served pasta or chocolate shavings to garnish a dessert. It has a nice curve, and should last or years. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Bunson Honeydew

customer_reviews.title: Zest in half the time!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made grater/zester with a new blade design that is flat, bi-directional and faster and more efficient than traditional graters. Nicely finished with a protective cover. Another nice feature is a slight angle which makes the work more ergonomic. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: C. Ball

customer_reviews.title: It broke.  Fast.
customer_reviews.text: Sometime around the 6th use, it broke and we can't use it anymore. Before it broke, it was to hard to clean for us to want to use it all that much.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Exposed Blades Too Dangerous For Me
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like it. Exposed blades make it too hazardous. Works only with rather soft vegetables, but could not get much more than mush with raw potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Wis

customer_reviews.title: Super Zester
customer_reviews.text: Loooove this zester! I call it my super zester. I can zest a large lemon in less time and less frustration. Great use for all recipes that requires zest.
customer_reviews.author: M. Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Sabatier 5218179 West Blade Rotary Grater, Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomic, attractive and very functional. As far as I can tell there is only one drum. I don't have a dishwasher so clean up wasn't as easy as they claim. Still recommended!
customer_reviews.author: new yorker

customer_reviews.title: Nice Zester for Fruit
customer_reviews.text: A really nice Zester that takes off the tasty peel and not the bitter inside. REally nice tool, well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to use, dishwasher safe! This is a really convenient grater that I use often.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This coarse flake grater is good quality and works well. It is especially good for parmesan.
customer_reviews.author: Oceania

product_meta.title: Sabatier West Blade Handheld Manual Rotary Grater with Stainless Steel Patented Flake Grating Drum, 11.5-Inch, Black
product_meta.description: Style Name:Rotary GraterState-of-the-art micro blade technology is the key to this rotary grater's performance, which relies on an easy turning motion to shred and flake ingredients. This handheld rotary grater includes a grating barrel that creates medium flakes—with ultra-sharp stainless-steel etched blades that make quick work of prep tasks. The crank is geared for smooth action, and the soft-touch, nonslip handle provides a comfortable grip as you work. Rapidly grate cheese, chocolate, or coconut. Dishwasher safe for easy and fast clean up, top rack recommended.
feature_bullets: PATENTED TECHNOLOGY: West Blade is a patented technology that revolutionizes zesting and grating
PRECISION GRATING: Rotary grater features a fine flake drum, which creates paper-thin flakes of hard cheese and chocolate
BI-DIRECTIONAL GRATING BARREL: Bi-directional, 18/8 stainless steel grating barrel ensures that grating happens when rotating handle forward or backward
COMFORTABLE GRIP: Contoured, ergonomically-designed handle ensures optimal comfort while in use.
EASY CLEAN UP: Dishwasher safe for quick and easy clean up.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars142 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
